resources.string: This feature is not enabled for all API keys. Please contact your DriveQuant contact if you are interested in changing this configuration.
Delete your account permanently?\nThis action is not reversible.
If you confirm your choice, you will be automatically logged out and the account deletion request will be taken into account.

You have 30 days to re-login to the application. If you reconnect within 30 days, the account deletion request will be cancelled.

After this time, if you do not log back in, all your data will be permanently deleted.

The deletion of your data is not reversible.
The account deletion feature is disabled for your API key.\nPlease contact your DriveQuant contact if you want to enable it.

To initialize the DriveKit SDK, it is essential to configure a unique identifier for each user.\n\nWe recommend that you enter an anonymous identifier and never use a phone number or an email address.
Please enter a unique user ID
An error has occurred, please try again later.
The Driver Achievement component contains a function to reward driver achievements with badges. Badges are awarded according to driving scores.

The driving challenge is a one-time event during which drivers compete to get the best driving score. The Challenge component includes several themes: eco-driving, safety, distraction and speed limit.
DriveKit is a rich and versatile SDK that includes phone sensor analysis, driving data display, driver coaching and gamification features. Discover these features before embedding in your app ðŸš€.
The onboarding permissions is not available because you have already granted all permissions.
The Permissions Utils component contains a diagnostic function to check the status of sensors and permissions. This component alerts the user and guides him to set up his phone.

The Permissions Utils component contains screens that display the permission requests that are essential for automatic mode operation and data analysis. We recommend that you use this component or replicate it in your app.

The Driver Data component displays the driver profile based on the driver\'s history. The driver profile is composed of several faces that reflect driving habits: the annual driving distance, the mobility radius, the activity level, the regularity and the main road context.
The Driver Achievement component displays rankings by time period and by score. The driver can visualise his rank and compare his driving performance with his community.
Combos reward drivers who manage to complete several consecutive trips with high scores. To install this feature in your app, see the documentation for the Drivers Achievement component.

The Driver Data component contains a UI sub-module allowing to display the Synthesis. This screen contains the driver\'s scores for each theme and according to the selected period. It also has a gauge to compare him to his community.
The Driver Data component contains a UI sub-module that displays Timelines. These screens contain graphs that represent the chronological evolution of a driver\'s weekly or monthly scores.

The Driver Data component shows the results of the driving data analysis. It includes a list of trips and a map display with scores presented by theme: safety, eco-driving, distraction and speed limit.
Driver Data | List and display of trips

The Vehicle component displays the list of vehicles and their characteristics. It allows to add, replace or delete a vehicle. The activation mode is configurable per vehicle (GPS, iBeacon or Bluetooth device).
The Vehicle component includes a function to display the analyzed distance and an estimation of the annual distance. The user can also enter the mileage read from the car\'s odometer.
The Trip Analysis component offers the option of adjusting the trip recording hours. It is also possible to label the trips for each configured time slot (business or personal).

Notifications are very important to understand the app's behaviour. They inform users that a trip is being analysed, cancelled or completed.

After a few days or weeks, users may not want to see all the notifications because they have become familiar with how it works.

Therefore, we invite you to integrate a notification manager into your app with the settings below. To do this, simply replicate the code from the demo app.
Notify me when a trip has been cancelled or if it is waiting for analysis.
Notify me as soon as a trip has been analyzed.
Do not display a notification when a trip is being analyzed.
Always notify me and display a notification when a trip is being analyzed.
A user has an anonymous unique identifier (userId). Optionally, you can add information to the user\'s account such as first name, last name and a nickname.
The automatic mode is in idle mode. Enable this function if you want the application to automatically detect and analyze your trips.
The automatic mode is activated. In this configuration, the application analyzes your trips without any manual action even if it is in the background.
Find out how to configure the notifications sent by the DriveKit SDK during and after the analysis of a trip.

The recording of trip data is possible provided that the user authorizes the application to access the phone's sensors when the application is running in the background.

To help you implement a permission gathering path we have developed the Permissions Utils component which contains all the requests and follows the recommendations to ensure your app works properly and your app is validated for deployment on the app stores.

We advise you to integrate Permission Utils in your app or to replicate this path identically.
This example simulates a boat trip of about a 20 kilometers. It can be used to test the detection of alternative modes of transportation.
This trip corresponds to a bus trip. It can be used to test the detection of alternative modes of transportation.
This example simulates a city trip that lasts just over 20 minutes. The average speed in this road context is 25km/h.
This 15-minute mixed trip includes a fast portion and an urban portion.
This example is a short trip with a collision that the detection algorithm does not confirm.
This example is a short trip with a confirmed accident at a speed of 10 km/h.
This example is a short trip with a confirmed accident at a speed of 20 km/h.
This example is a short trip with a confirmed accident at a speed of 30 km/h.

The purpose of the simulator is to help you reproduce a trip and understand the life cycle of the Trip Analysis component of DriveKit. We advise you to use it after the SDK integration. It reproduces real GPS data for several types of trips.

It is a test tool, you should not embed it in a production application.

We also recommend that you always test your application in real conditions before publishing it.
Automatic mode is disabled. No trips can be analyzed automatically.
You must activate the developer mode to access the option to select a mock application and allow the application to work properly. To do this, follow the official documentation.
To make the simulator work properly, you must select this application as the mock location app. To do this, type \"mock location\" in the parameters search, and select this application.
All vehicles have an auto-start mode disabled. No trips can be analyzed automatically.
This 55-minute trip mainly covers a 100 km stretch of motorway. The average speed is 110 km/h.
This example simulates a trip that is too short to evaluate driver behaviour. It lets you see what type of displays would be appropriate in this case.
This will stop the current trip.
This example simulates a suburban trip lasting 30 minutes. The average speed is 62 km/h.
This trip corresponds to a train commute and can be used to test the alternative transportation modes detection.
The service is unavailable, please try again later
You can add information to a user\'s account such as first name, last name, and pseudo.\n\nThis data is optional and you can skip this step.

The application calculates driving indicators and scores to evaluate the driver's behavior. The calculation of the scores takes into account the main characteristics of the vehicle such as its mass and the type of engine.

To help you configure a vehicle we have developed the Vehicle component which contains a simple path to help the user set up his vehicle in two ways: (1) from the type (city car, sedan for example) or (2) from the make, model and version.

We advise you to integrate the Vehicle component in your app to save time.
Your API key is not valid

To use this demo application, it is essential to configure a valid API key. 

For more information on configuring the key, follow the instructions in our documentation.

If you do not have an API key, contact us at contact@drivequant.com.
Your API key is not configured
